translations.english: He reduced land taxes, restoring the fifteen percent tax.

translations.chinese: 爵五大夫、吏六百石以上及宦皇帝而知 名者有罪當盜械者，皆頌繫。
translations.english: Grand masters and officials of six hundred piculs and above and eunuchs who served the emperor and were known by name who had crimes deserving shackles for theft were all pardoned and released.

translations.chinese: 上造以上及內外公孫耳孫有罪當刑及當為城旦舂者，皆耐為鬼薪白粲。
translations.english: Grand builders and above and inner and outer grandsons and grandsons who had crimes deserving punishment and deserving to be city wall pounders were all tattooed to become firewood cutters and rice cleaners.

translations.chinese: 民年七十以上若不滿十歲有罪當刑者，皆完之。
translations.english: People aged seventy and above or below ten who had crimes deserving punishment were all spared.

translations.chinese: 又曰：「吏所以 治民也，能盡其治則民賴之，故重其祿，所以為民也。
translations.english: He also said: "Officials are what govern the people. If they can fully carry out their governance then the people rely on them, so their salaries are made heavy, because it is for the people.
